content: GIMP is a free, layer-based graphics editor you can use to edit, retouch, and convert images. While the XCF file type is the default format for saving images with GIMP, you may also export the images in archives compressed with bzip2, XZ, or gzip compression algorithms.

description: An XCFBZ2 file is an archive compressed with the Burrows-Wheeler compression algorithm (bzip2) that contains an .XCF image created by the GIMP image editor. It is a .BZ2 archive that users export from GIMP when backing up XCF images or transferring to another location. XCFBZ2 files are more commonly saved as .XCF.BZ2 files.

instructions: You can open XCFBZ2 files with GIMP in Windows, macOS, and Linux. To open an XCFBZ2 file with GIMP, select File â†’ Open.

Since XCFBZ2 files are BZ2 archives, you can use a compression utility that supports the format to extract the XCF images they contain. However, you may need to rename the .xcfbz2 file extension to .bz2 before decompressing an XCFBZ2 file. Possible options include bzip2 (multiplatform), Apple Archive Utility (Mac), 7-Zip (Windows), and PeaZip (multiplatform).
